resources.string: The "su" binary was not found on your phone. This application will not work without root.
Failure! There is either not enough space on your SDcard or your SDcard is mounted! \n\n Check that your SDcard is not mounted and that you have at least 1.6mb of free space available then try again.
It looks like the installation of BusyBox was not successful. \n\n Try installing to a different location, that may resolve the issue.
I could not determine whether or not you have given Busybox root access. This application will NOT work if we do not have root access!

BusyBox Installer was not allowed root access! 

 This may be an issue with Superuser, open Superuser and make sure that you are allowing us root access. 

 This application will not work without root access.
could not be mounted as RW, the install may fail.
Before hitting the install button, please make sure you have remounted the /system partition of your phone to RW Access. Do not continue until after you complete this.
More than one copy of BusyBox was found.
Not enough space to install busybox, we need at least 1600kb free \n\n Try removing some things to free up some space or try a different installation path.
Select where you want to install BusyBox \n All other copies of BusyBox will be removed.

This feature will allow you to see all of the applets that are included with my versions of Busybox from 1.18.5 on up. 

 This feature will also allow you to check each applet, find out if it is installed, where it is installed, and the usage for the applet if it is installed. 

 If you have an application which needs a specific applet and it is NOT here, please email me at StericDroid@gmail.com with the applet name and I will get it included ASAP.
BusyBox is not currently installed on your device.

It looks like the installation of BusyBox was successful! Congratulations! \n\n Keep in mind that by keeping this installed you will be notified whenever a new version of BusyBox is ready to be installed.

It looks like BusyBox is installed, but It does not appear to be the version that you selected to have installed, you may want to try the installation again but this time using a different installation location.

I am unable to verify whether or not certain utilities needed for this application to run are present and functional on your device \n\n. This problem could be cause by a device that is not properly rooted or by superuser settings that are misconfigured. Please try the install again.
Applets that are not checked will not be symlinked. \n (This is an advanced option)
Information about this Applet could not be found.
Long press an applet for more info on that applet.

Before hitting the uninstall button please consider that many root applications and custom roms require BusyBox to work, by uninstalling Busybox it could cause your rom and all of your root applications to stop working. 


This is an advanced option, and you should know how to reflash a rom, or repair your device in the event that removing Busybox does cause some undesired effect. 


Keep in mind that this will remove ALL symlinks which point to Busybox, This is an advanced option! 


DO NOT DO THIS UNLESS YOU KNOW EXACTLY WHAT YOU ARE DOING! I WILL NOT ANSWER EMAILS REGARDING THIS FEATURE, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!
It looks like the removal of BusyBox was successful! Congratulations!

It looks like the removal of BusyBox failed, either because we could not do so in a safe manner or because of some other technical problem. \n\n This may have left you with an non-useable system, which as stated before was one of the risks of removing BusyBox...you may need to reinstall your rom or do a system wipe to restore your device.

BusyBox combines tiny versions of many common UNIX utilities into a single small executable. It provides replacements for most of the utilities you usually find in GNU fileutils, shellutils, etc. The utilities in BusyBox generally have fewer options than their full-featured GNU cousins; however, the options that are included provide the expected functionality and behave very much like their GNU counterparts. BusyBox provides a fairly complete environment for any small or embedded system. 

 BusyBox has been written with size-optimization and limited resources in mind. It is also extremely modular so you can easily include or exclude commands (or features) at compile time. This makes it easy to customize your embedded systems. To create a working system, just add some device nodes in /dev, a few configuration files in /etc, and a Linux kernel. 

 BusyBox is maintained by Denys Vlasenko, and licensed under the GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE version 2. ( http://busybox.net/license.html ) 

 You can find more information about BusyBox here: http://busybox.net 

 To be clear, I (Stephen Erickson) Did not write BusyBox, I wrote the installer and I compile each version of BusyBox for Android and hand select which applets are needed for Android, based on request usually. 

 If you need an applet added, please email me at StericDroid@gmail.com
Smart Install is loading...You may go ahead and install Busybox or wait for Smart Install to finish loading.
To access the advanced features of Smart Install, touch the arrow above.

Welcome to Busybox! 

 Upgrade to pro today and get the following features: 

 Installation of any version of Busybox! 

 Additional support for Magisk and installing to sbin. 

 Faster loading times. 

 Ability to automatically update busybox. 

 Ability to install specific applets one by one and choosing how they are installed. 

 The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

For a limited time, Busybox Pro is on sale for $1.99 only instead of the regular $4.99 price! \n\n The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate
Would you like to use Smart Install, which provides a more thorough install with some small risks as it does replace applets or normal install which is much faster and a safer install.

This feature, and many others to come, is only available in the pro version of Busybox. 

 You can get the pro version here: 
 https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

This feature allows you to install any version of Busybox, not just the ones that I compile. With this feature you can install Busybox compiled against the NDK, uclib, older versions I have compiled or any other version you can find on the web. 

 This feature is only available in the pro version of Busybox. 

 You can get the pro version here: 
 https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

This feature will enable smart install which will allow you to customize the install behavior to your specific needs using the options in this list. 

 This feature is only available in the pro version of Busybox. 

 You can get the pro version here: 
 https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

Please be aware that using smart install is for advanced users only! \n\n Some binaries found on your system should NOT be replaced by Busybox and doing so can make your device perform in an undesireable manner. The only reason you should tweak the settings below is if you know exactly what you are doing or if you know how to reflash your rom to fix issues that may occur from modifying the selections below.
Unrecognized device architecture. This should be an easy fix for me to make, please email me at StericDroid@gmail.com with your device information and the following information:

There was a problem opening a shell with root access. This is either being caused by superuser/supersu or by a device that is inproperly rooted. 

 Try removing superuser/supersu permissions, uninstalling this application, reinstalling this application, and then regranting superuser/supersu permissions for this application. 

 You can check your device to see if it is properly rooted by downloading RootChecker from the Android market.
An unexpected error has occured, please take a screenshot of the application and send it to me at StericDroid@gmail.com
An error occured while trying to install Busybox, try restarting the application and try again or you can email me, StericDroid@gmail.com, about the problem.

We could not verify the integrity of the binary selected to be installed and as a result installation will not occur for the safety of your device. Please close the application and reopen it in order to re-attempt installation. If the issue persists, please email me at StericDroid@gmail.com so I can assist you with fixing this issue.
Systemless root is not configured, please choose another install location.
/su/xbin does not exist, please choose another install location.

The auto update feature automatically updates Busybox when a new version is available without any interaction from you. 

 Currently only the pro version of this app has this feature. 

 The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

The replace all feature tells the installation to replace all applets, both those currently symlinked and hardlinked, with symlinks to Busybox. 

 Currently only the pro version of this app has this feature. 

 The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

This feature will instruct the installer to make sure that applets are not duplicated after the install. This will keep your system cleaner, save more space, and will ensure that other applications do not have problems using the applets provided by Busybox. 

 Currently only the pro version of this app has this feature. 

 The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate

Just a quick note before installation, it looks like you are installing Busybox to /sbin. 

 The original contents of /sbin are always restored upon boot and as a result busybox will be removed from /sbin upon next boot. 

 Busybox Pro has a feature that can re-install busybox to /sbin upon boot so you do not have to manually re-install Busybox upon each reboot of your device. 

 The pro version of this application can be found here: https://market.android.com/details?id=stericson.busybox.donate 

 Close this dialog to continue with your installation!
